newsitem.title: FINLAND: GERMAN REPO NO FLOOR FOR FINNISH TENDER RATE - ETLA.
newsitem.headline: GERMAN REPO NO FLOOR FOR FINNISH TENDER RATE - ETLA.

text.p: The German repo rate is not a bottom for the Finnish tender rate, Pentti Vartia, managing director of the Research Institute of the Finnish Economy (ETLA), said on Wednesday
He said there was room for lower interest rates since Finnish inflation is low and unemployment remains high.
"The Bank of Finland can continue to lower interest rates even regardless of decisions of other EU countries," he said.
"German short term interest rates are not a bottom for Finnish rates as unemployment here is higher and inflation lower," Vartia told a news conference.
ETLA earlier released its economic forecast where it kept its forecasts consumer price rise unchanged at one percent in 1996 and at two percent in 1997.
It also kept its forecasts for unemployment rate unchanged at 16.5 percent for 1996 and at 16 percent for 1997 after 17.2 percent in 1995.
It raised its 1997 GDP growth forecast to 3.5 percent from 2.5 percent forecast in June.
